title: Fetching data to phonope api
body:
I have fetched data to phonepe api "https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/merchant-simulator/pg/v1/pay" the base 64 payload as request in body and Sha256 x-verify as x-verify in headers. When i fetch data on phonepe website postman it works and i get a transaction initiated response but It doesn't work on either localhost or on official website "wearmiho.com". Shows error ""Access to fetch at 'https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/merchant-simulator/pg/v1/pay' from origin 'https://www.wearmiho.com' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.""

I have tried to add mode: "no-cors" to headers but it still didn't worked shows error failed Possible reasons 1.) Maybe it needs to have the domain name pre-register on phonepe As for example firebase requires some registered domain to have access to its functionalities I have talked to the phonepe team they said for test credentials it should work on any url like localhost or live website 2.) Maybe my code got some error but its the same as on phonepe postman ref "https://developer.phonepe.com/v1/reference/pay-api#pay-request-for-web-flow"(the side postman ALso i used js)
why: Potentially bad ip for hostname in body - www.wearmiho.com suspicious IP address 198.49.23.144
markdown:
I have fetched data to phonepe api "https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/merchant-simulator/pg/v1/pay" the base 64 payload as request in body and Sha256 x-verify as x-verify in headers. When i fetch data on phonepe website postman it works and i get a transaction initiated response but It doesn't work on either localhost or on official website "wearmiho.com".
Shows error 
""Access to fetch at 'https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/merchant-simulator/pg/v1/pay' from origin 'https://www.wearmiho.com' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.""



I have tried to add mode: "no-cors" to headers but it still didn't worked shows error failed
Possible reasons 
1.) Maybe it needs to have the domain name pre-register on phonepe As for example firebase requires some registered domain to have access to its functionalities I have talked to the phonepe team they said for test credentials it should work on any url like localhost or live website
2.) Maybe my code got some error but its the same as on phonepe postman ref "https://developer.phonepe.com/v1/reference/pay-api#pay-request-for-web-flow"(the side postman ALso i used js)

title: In phonepe payment gateway implement on website (codeigniter) "paymentInstrument type" I'm passing is "PAY_PAGE" but in resonse getting "UPI_INTENT"
body:
I am trying to implement phonepe payment gateway on website using codeigniter framework..till yesterday the test response was coming r8 but suddenly the response has changed and its not working.

My CURL data:

                $con = json_decode($json);
                $con->merchantId = "PGTESTPAYUAT"; //my merchant id for testing 
                $con->merchantTransactionId = "ABCD12345";
                $con->merchantUserId = "A123R";
                $con->amount = 10000;  //100 rupees
                $con->redirectUrl = "https://abc.in/after_payment";
                $con->callbackUrl = "https://abc.in/webhook";
                $con->mobileNumber = "9876543210";
                $con->paymentInstrument->type = "PAY_PAGE";

                $encode = json_encode($con);
                $encoded = base64_encode($encode);
                $salt_key = "099eb0cd-02cf-4e2a-8aca-3e6c6aff0399"; //test salt key
                $salt_index = 1; //key index 1
                $string = $encoded . "/pg/v1/pay" . $salt_key;
                $sha256 = hash("sha256", $string);
                $final_x_header = $sha256 . '###' . $salt_index;
                $request_json = '{
    "request":""
}';
                $request_json_decode = json_decode($request_json);
                $request_json_decode->request = $encoded;
                $request = json_encode($request_json_decode);

                $curl = curl_init();

                curl_setopt_array($curl, [
                    CURLOPT_URL => "https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/merchant-simulator/pg/v1/pay",
                    CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
                    CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
                    CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
                    CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
                    CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
                    CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
                    CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => $request,
                    CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
                        "Content-Type: application/json",
                        "X-VERIFY: " . $final_x_header,
                        "accept: application/json"
                    ],
                ]);

                $response = curl_exec($curl);
                $err = curl_error($curl);

                curl_close($curl);

                if ($err) {
                    echo "Error #:" . $err;
                } else {
                    $res = json_decode($response);
                    pr($res);
                    if ($res->code == 'PAYMENT_INITIATED') {
                        redirect($res->data->instrumentResponse->redirectInfo->url);
                    } else {
                        redirect('web/checkout');
                    }
                }

stdClass Object
(
    [success] => 1
    [code] => PAYMENT_INITIATED

    [data] => stdClass Object

            [merchantId] => PGTESTPAYUAT
            [merchantTransactionId] => AM434928276

                    [type] => UPI_INTENT //you can clearly see i had passed PAY_PAGE but got UPI_INTENT in respose

title: Mobile POS Terminals in India
body:
As of my last knowledge update in January 2022, mobile Point of Sale (POS) terminals have become increasingly popular in India, providing businesses with a convenient and flexible way to process transactions. Mobile POS systems typically involve the use of smartphones or tablets with a card reader attachment. These systems are used by various businesses, including small retailers, food establishments, and service providers. Here are some companies and services offering mobile POS solutions in India:

Paytm:

Mobile POS Terminals in India solution that allows businesses to accept payments through debit/credit cards, UPI, and other digital payment methods. MobiSwipe:

MobiSwipe offers mobile POS solutions for businesses to accept card payments using smartphones or tablets. They provide card readers that can be attached to mobile devices. PhonePe for Business:

PhonePe, a popular digital payment platform, offers business solutions that include a mobile POS system. Merchants can accept payments through UPI, debit/credit cards, and more. BharatPe:

BharatPe provides a range of payment solutions for businesses, including a mobile POS system. It allows merchants to accept payments through UPI, QR codes, and card transactions. PayU:

PayU is a payment gateway service that offers a mobile POS solution. It enables businesses to accept online and offline payments, including card transactions. MSwipe:

MSwipe is known for providing POS solutions, including mobile POS devices. Merchants can accept card payments, and the company offers various card reader options. Pine Labs:

Pine Labs offers a variety of POS solutions, including mobile POS devices. They provide services for both online and offline transactions.

title: React-native app's UPI payment deeplink URL issue
body:
I'm building a react native android app using expo where i'm trying to scan a qr code,get payment data,then open UPI apps available in my mobile prefilled with payment info and make the payment. I achieved this using the below snippet but when i try to pay, payment fails saying "Payment restricted for security reasons", "Cannot pay more than 2000 while importing from gallery, try using mobile number, upi id or scan qr", "Exceeded transaction limit per day" etc., across all the apps except for Axis bank's mobile app. Please suggest any ways so that i can complete the payment in phonepe, gpay and other upi apps as well. Thanks in advance.

This is my code snippet

const handlePayment = (amount: string, notes: string) => { const amountTemp = (parseFloat(amount) || 1).toFixed(2); const url =upi://pay?pa=${upiId}&pn=${payeeName}&am=${amountTemp}&cu=INR&tn=${notes}; Linking.canOpenURL(url) .then((supported) => { if (!supported) { Alert.alert("PhonePe is not installed on this device"); } else { return Linking.openURL(url); } }) .catch((err) => console.error("Error opening the app:", err)); };

title: Error Code 406 while integrating PhonePe Payment Gateway using Pay API in ASP.Net C# Website
body:
Getting Error 406-Not Acceptable Response From Ajax API Call. After Searching I came to know that Response Format And Accept Format Is Different. My API Response Is In JSON So I Changed Accept Format To 'application/json' from 'text/plain' then instead of 406 error I am Getting Empty String In Response.

I am using Javascript & Jquery For API Integration. Here Is My Code For Reference

const settings = {
                             async: true,
                             crossDomain: true,
                             url: 'https://api-preprod.phonepe.com/apis/pg-sandbox/pg/v1/pay',
                             method:  'post',
                             headers: {
                                 accept: 'text/plain',
                                 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' ,
                            'X-VERIFY' : 'XXXXXXXXXXXX' //SHA256(base64 Encoded Payload + “/pg/v1/pay” +salt key) + ### + salt index
                     },
                     processData: false,
                     data: '{request : XXXXXXXXXXXX}' //BASE64 Encoded Payload
                 };
         $.ajax(settings).done(function (response) {
                             alert(response);
                             console.log(response);
                         }).fail(function (err) {
                            alert(err.responseText);
                         });

title: React-native app's UPI payment completion issue
body:
I'm building a react native android app using expo where i'm trying to scan a qr code,get payment data,then open UPI apps available in my mobile prefilled with payment info and make the payment. I achieved this using the below snippet but when i try to pay, payment fails saying "Payment restricted for security reasons", "Cannot pay more than 2000 while importing from gallery, try using mobile number, upi id or scan qr", "Exceeded transaction limit per day" etc., across all the apps except for Axis bank's mobile app. Please suggest any ways so that i can complete the payment in phonepe, gpay and other upi apps as well as there are some restrictions in the UPI apps. Thanks in advance.

This is my code snippet

` const handlePayment = (amount: string, notes: string) => {
    const amountTemp = (parseFloat(amount) || 1).toFixed(2);
    const url = `upi://pay?pa=${upiId}&pn=${payeeName}&am=${amountTemp}&cu=INR&tn=${notes}`;
    Linking.canOpenURL(url)
      .then((supported) => {
        if (!supported) {
          Alert.alert("UPI app is not installed on this device");
        } else {
          return Linking.openURL(url);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error("Error opening the app:", err));
  };`
why: Potentially bad keyword in body - Position 587-594: phonepe
